API Reference¶

.. py:module:: scraper_etc.scraper_etc

.. py:function:: http_GET(url, header=None, timeout=30) :module: scraper_etc.scraper_etc

Perform a standard HTTP GET request with optional custom headers and timeout.

This function wraps requests.get() to simplify making GET requests with a consistent interface. If no headers are provided, a default user-agent and header set are used to reduce the likelihood of being flagged as a bot by target websites.

:type url: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:\:py\:class\:\str`    :param url: The full URL to request via HTTP GET.    :type url: str    :type header: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:data:`~typing.Optional`\ \[:py:class:`~typing.Dict`\ \[:py:class:`str`, :py:class:`str`]]   :param header: Optional headers to include in the request. IfNone, a default header mimicking a                   modern browser (e.g., Firefox 128) will be used.    :type header: dict[str, str] | None, optional    :type timeout: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`float`   :param timeout: Maximum number of seconds to wait for a response before raising arequests.Timeout`. Default is 30 seconds. :type timeout: float, optional

:returns: The Response object containing server response data, including status code, headers, and content. :rtype: requests.Response

:raises requests.Timeout: If the server does not send a response within timeout seconds. :raises requests.RequestException: For any other network-related errors encountered during the request.

.. rubric:: Examples

response = http_GET(“https://example.com”) print(response.status_code) 200 print(response.text[:100]) ‘<!doctype html>…’

.. py:function:: http_GET_valid_pdf(url, header=None, raise_error=False) :module: scraper_etc.scraper_etc

Perform an HTTP GET request and verify that the response is a valid PDF.

This function wraps http_GET() and performs two validation checks:

  • Ensures the response has a 200 OK status code.

  • Ensures the response content starts with the PDF signature (“%PDF”).

:type url: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:\:py\:class\:\str`    :param url: The full URL to request via HTTP GET.    :type url: str    :type header: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:data:`~typing.Optional`\ \[:py:class:`~typing.Dict`\ \[:py:class:`str`, :py:class:`str`]]    :param header: Optional headers to include in the request. If None, a default anti-bot header is used.    :type header: dict[str, str] | None, optional    :type raise_error: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`bool`` :param raise_error: If True, raises an error for any of the following: - Non-200 status code - Response content is not a valid PDF :type raise_error: bool, optional

:returns: The requests.Response object if the request succeeds and content is a valid PDF. Returns False if either check fails and raise_error is False. :rtype: requests.Response or bool

:raises requests.RequestException: For any network-related errors during the request. :raises requests.HTTPError: If the response status code is not 200 and raise_error=True. :raises ValueError: If the response is not a valid PDF and raise_error=True.

.. rubric:: Examples

res = http_GET_valid_pdf(“https://example.com/file.pdf”) if res: … with open(“file.pdf”, “wb”) as f: … f.write(res.content)

.. py:function:: response_is_pdf(res, raise_error=False) :module: scraper_etc.scraper_etc

Check if an HTTP response has a 200 OK status code.

This function verifies whether the given requests.Response object indicates a successful HTTP request (status code 200). If raise_error is set to True, it raises a requests.HTTPError with details about the failed response.

:type res: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:\:py\:class\:\~requests.models.Response`   :param res: The response object returned byrequests.get(), requests.post(), etc.    :type res: requests.Response    :type raise_error: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`bool`` :param raise_error: Whether to raise an HTTPError if the response status code is not 200. If False, the function returns False and prints a warning message. :type raise_error: bool, default False

:returns: True if the response status code is 200; otherwise, False. :rtype: bool

:raises requests.HTTPError: If raise_error=True and the response status code is not 200.

.. rubric:: Examples

response = requests.get(“https://example.com”) response_is_valid(response) True

response = requests.get(“https://example.com/broken”) response_is_valid(response) Status code 404 False

response_is_valid(response, raise_error=True) Traceback (most recent call last): … requests.exceptions.HTTPError: …

.. py:function:: response_is_valid(res, raise_error=False) :module: scraper_etc.scraper_etc

Check whether a requests.Response object has a successful (HTTP 200 OK) status code.

This helper function evaluates whether the response was successful. If the status code is not 200 and raise_error is True, it raises a requests.HTTPError. Otherwise, it prints a warning and returns False.

:type res: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:\:py\:class\:\~requests.models.Response`    :param res: The response object to validate.    :type res: requests.Response    :type raise_error: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`bool`   :param raise_error: If True, raises arequests.HTTPErrorwhen the status code is not 200.                        If False, prints the error and returnsFalse`. :type raise_error: bool, default False

:returns: True if the response status code is 200 (OK), False otherwise. :rtype: bool

:raises requests.HTTPError: If the response code is not 200 and raise_error=True.

.. rubric:: Examples

res = requests.get(“https://example.com”) if response_is_valid(res): … print(“Success!”)

Raise an error instead of printing

response_is_valid(res, raise_error=True)

.. py:function:: setup_chrome_driver(user_agent=None, undetected_chrome=True, chrome_main_version=138, headless=False, add_default_options=True, additional_options=None, experimental_options=None) :module: scraper_etc.scraper_etc

Instantiates and returns a configured Chrome WebDriver instance.

This function creates a Chrome WebDriver instance using either the standard selenium.webdriver.Chrome or the stealthier undetected_chromedriver.Chrome. It supports customizing user agents, headless mode, default security workarounds, and the ability to inject additional or experimental driver options.

:type user_agent: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:\:py\:data\:\~typing.Optional`\ \[:py:class:`str`]    :param user_agent: Custom user agent string to be used by the driver. If None, a generic                       desktop Chrome user agent is used.    :type user_agent: str or None, default None    :type undetected_chrome: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`bool`   :param undetected_chrome: If True, usesundetected_chromedriver.Chrome, which is designed to                              bypass basic bot-detection techniques. If False, uses the standard                              selenium.webdriver.Chrome.    :type undetected_chrome: bool, default True    :type chrome_main_version: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`int`   :param chrome_main_version: Only used whenundetected_chrome=True. Specifies the main Chrome version                                installed on your system. This helps undetected_chromedriver locate the                                appropriate driver version.    :type chrome_main_version: int, default 131    :type headless: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`bool`    :param headless: If True, Chrome will run in headless mode (no GUI). This is useful for                     running in server environments or CI pipelines.    :type headless: bool, default False    :type add_default_options: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`bool`    :param add_default_options: If True, appends a set of default options aimed at increasing stability                                and bypassing common certificate or security errors:                                    [                                        "--ignore-certificate-errors",                                        "--disable-dev-shm-usage",                                        "--disable-extensions",                                        "--disable-browser-side-navigation",                                        "--disable-web-security",                                        "--allow-insecure-localhost"                                    ]    :type add_default_options: bool, default True    :type additional_options: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:data:`~typing.Optional`\ \[:py:class:`~typing.List`\ \[:py:class:`str`]]   :param additional_options: A list of additional Chrome command-line options to pass (e.g.,                              –disable-popup-blocking, –start-maximized). These are passed                               directly to options.add_argument(…).    :type additional_options: list of str or None, default None    :type experimental_options: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:data:`~typing.Optional`\ \[:py:class:`~typing.Dict`\ \[:py:class:`str`, :py:data:`~typing.Union`\ \[:py:class:`str`, :py:class:`int`, :py:class:`~typing.Dict`]]]   :param experimental_options: A dictionary of experimental options to be passed to                                options.add_experimental_option(key, value)`. For example: {“excludeSwitches”: [“enable-automation”]} :type experimental_options: dict[str, object] or None, default None

:returns: A Chrome driver instance with the specified configuration. :rtype: selenium.webdriver.Chrome or undetected_chromedriver.Chrome

.. py:function:: webdriver_wait(driver, by, selector, delay=10) :module: scraper_etc.scraper_etc

Wait for a specific web element to be present in the DOM using Selenium’s WebDriverWait.

:type driver: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type:\:py\:class\:\~selenium.webdriver.chrome.webdriver.WebDriver`    :param driver: The webdriver instance to search with. Works with undetected_chromedriver too.    :type driver: selenium.webdriver.Chrome    :type by: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:data:`~typing.Literal`\ \[``’CSS_SELECTOR’``, ``’XPATH’``, ``’ID’``, ``’CLASS_NAME’``, ``’NAME’``, ``’TAG_NAME’``, ``’LINK_TEXT’``]    :param by:               The type of selector to use. Must be one of:                   ["CSS_SELECTOR", "XPATH", "ID", "CLASS_NAME", "NAME", "TAG_NAME", "LINK_TEXT"]               Case-insensitive.    :type by: str    :type selector: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`str`    :param selector: The actual query string to locate the element.    :type selector: str    :type delay: :sphinx_autodoc_typehints_type::py:class:`float`` :param delay: Maximum number of seconds to wait before raising a TimeoutException. :type delay: float, default 10

:returns: The first element matching the selector, once it appears in the DOM. :rtype: selenium.webdriver.remote.webelement.WebElement

:raises ValueError: If by is not a recognized selector type. :raises TimeoutException: If no matching element is found before the timeout.
